newsitem.title: FRANCE: DHL SAYS EX-EUROPE TO US TRAFFIC UP 10 PCT.
newsitem.headline: DHL SAYS EX-EUROPE TO US TRAFFIC UP 10 PCT.

text.p: DHL Worldwide Express said it had noted a moderate 10 percent increase in traffic between Europe and the U.S. since the start of the strike by Teamster employees of United Parcel Service.

"Outbound volumes at the start of the week were at the same level as last week's but as there is an August traffic dip, we're estimating a gain of about 10 percent," Guy Collette, Corporate Affairs spokesman for DHL in Europe, told Reuters from Brussels.
DHL's domestic and international volumes in the U.S. had increased by an estimated 33 percent, Collette said.

"In the U.S. we have put extra aircraft into service while our existing fleet is making additional frequencies We have also hired part-time staff to cope with the upsurge in traffic. However, the current situation does not justify any changes to our European operations at the moment." - Reuters Air Cargo Service Tel+ 44 171 542 7706 Fax +5017 - www.racs.com
